page.title: 05KNITTING
page.content: MANY PEOPLE IN BURRA KNIT FOR MONEY. NEARLY EVERY WEEK OR TWO THE KNITTERS MAKE ON AVERAGE TEN SWEATERS.SOME PEOPLE ALSO MAKE SCARVES,GLOVES,SOCKS ETC.MOST PEOPLE DONT HAVE TO MAKE A WHOLE SWEATER.JUST THE BODY,ARMS AND RIBS NOT THE YOKES AND GET OTHER PEOPLE TO SEW IN THREADS.YOU DONT GET VERY MUCH MONEY FOR MAKING THE SWEATERS IT USUALLY DEPENDS ON HOW COMPLICATED THE SWEATER IS.MAKING SWEATERS PROBABLY COULDNT KEEP A FAMILY GOING. 15.2% OF THE POPULATION SURVEYED WERE STILL EMPLOYED IN THE KNITTING INDUSTRY.IN 1985 WHICH REPRESENTS QUITE A DRASTIC DECLINE OF KNITTERS IN BURRA IN THE LAST TWENTY YEARS.MOST WOMEN STILL KNIT FOR THEIR FAMILY AND NOT FOR PROFIT.SOME PEOPLE CAN MAKE UP SOME NICE PATTERNS OUT OF THEIR HEADS WITH NO PATTERN TO FOLLOW.
